Package bio.singa.mathematics.matrices

Class SymmetricMatrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • bio.singa.mathematics.matrices.RegularMatrix
      • bio.singa.mathematics.matrices.SquareMatrix
        • bio.singa.mathematics.matrices.SymmetricMatrix
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Addable<Matrix>, AdditivelyInvertible<Matrix>, Invertible<Matrix>, MultiDimensional<Matrix>, Multipliable<Matrix>, Ring<Matrix>, Subtractable<Matrix>, Matrix, Transformable<Matrix>, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LabeledSymmetricMatrix
    public class SymmetricMatrix
extends SquareMatrix
    The SymmetricMatrix implementation only stores a the main diagonal and one copy of the symmetric values.
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Symmetric matrix, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SymmetricMatrix

        public SymmetricMatrix​(double[][] values)
        Creates a new SymmetricMatrix with the given double values. The first index of the double array represents the row index and the second index represents the column index.

        The following array: 

         {{1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, {2.0, 5.0, 6.0}, {3.0, 6.0, 9.0}}
        result in the matrix: 
         1.0  2.0  3.0
 2.0  5.0  6.0
 3.0  6.0  9.0
        Parameters:
        values - The values of the matrix.

    • Method Detail

      • isSymmetric

        public static boolean isSymmetric​(double[][] potentialValues)
        Returns true if the potential values are square and symmetric (mirrored at the main diagonal) and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        potentialValues - The potential values of a symmetric matrix.
        Returns:
        true if the potential values are square and symmetric and false otherwise.

      • isSymmetric

        public static boolean isSymmetric​(Matrix matrix)
        Returns true if the given matrix is square and symmetric (mirrored at the main diagonal) and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given matrix is square and symmetric and false otherwise.

      • assertThatValuesAreSymmetric

        public static void assertThatValuesAreSymmetric​(double[][] potentialValues)
        Asserts that the given potential values are square and symmetric and throws an IncompatibleDimensionsException otherwise.
        Parameters:
        potentialValues - The potential values of a symmetric matrix.
        Throws:
        IncompatibleDimensionsException - if the given matrix is not square and symmetric.

      • isCompact

        public static boolean isCompact​(double[][] potentialValues)
        Returns true if the values are already arranged in an jagged array and false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        potentialValues - The potential values.
        Returns:
        true if the values are already arranged in an jagged array and false otherwise.

      • compactToSymmetricMatrix

        public static double[][] compactToSymmetricMatrix​(double[][] potentialValues)
        Compacts the values of a symmetric matrix into a jagged array, that represents the lower triangular part of a symmetric matrix.

        The following array: 

         {{1.0, 2.0, 3.0}, {2.0, 5.0, 6.0}, {3.0, 6.0, 9.0}}
        compacts to the array: 
         {{1.0}, {2.0, 5.0}, {3.0, 6.0, 9.0}}
        which results in the matrix: 
         1.0
 2.0  5.0
 3.0  6.0  9.0
        Parameters:
        potentialValues - The potentially compact values to be converted
        Returns:
        The compacted values.
